comment.author: 62379908@N00
comment._content: This plane has very poor visibility. No windshield, and the two square windows are too far back.  I seem to remember reading that they considered a periscope, but rejected it because of the extra drag. Fortunately there wasn't any other air traffic over the Atlantic.  Landing would be less of a problem, because pilots of high-wing monoplanes usually look out the side as they are landing, but I still can hardly believe that he flew it.
